metadata.Title: CVE-2023-47234 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in FRRouting FRR through 9.0.1. A crash can occur when processing a crafted BGP UPDATE message with a MP_UNREACH_NLRI attribute and additional NLRI data (that lacks mandatory path attributes).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-47234` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 8.4.4-1.1ubuntu1.2
frr-pythontools - 8.4.4-1.1ubuntu1.2
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 8.4.4-1.1ubuntu1.2
frr-snmp - 8.4.4-1.1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> the quagga project was renamed to frr mdeslaur> The code in quagga is different, there is no indication quagga is vulnerable to this issue, marking as not-affected for now

criterions.comment: frr package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.4.4-1.1ubuntu1.2').
